nodes.bodyText: I am removing jest-cli for now because I haven't used any of its feature.

Adding a version number. From CircleCI official doc:
If you would like to invalidate your cache manually, you can bump v1 to v2 in your config.yml file. In this case, you would now have a new cache key v2-npm-deps, which will trigger the storing of a new cache.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -298,15 +298,15 @@ jobs:
           command: git submodule update --init --recursive
       - restore_cache:
           keys:
-          - e2e-test-cache-{{ checksum "~/workbench/e2e/yarn.lock" }}
-          - e2e-test-cache-
+          - v1-e2e-test-cache-{{ checksum "~/workbench/e2e/yarn.lock" }}

nodes.bodyText: Just to check, this is writing to circle, right? and nowhere else?
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -317,9 +317,12 @@ jobs:
       - run:
           name: Run e2e tests (Puppeteer and Jest)
           working_directory: ~/workbench/e2e
-          command: yarn --silent test:ci
+          command: yarn test:ci
       - store_artifacts:
           path: e2e/logs
+          destination: logs
+      - store_test_results:
+          path: ~/workbench/e2e/logs

nodes.bodyText:
In e2e project, screenshot or/and html file are saved in /logs sub-directory. If you run tests on localhost, you'll find failed screenshots and html files in /logs dir.
We have to set store_test_results key to tell CircleCI where to find saved files.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -317,9 +317,12 @@ jobs:
       - run:
           name: Run e2e tests (Puppeteer and Jest)
           working_directory: ~/workbench/e2e
-          command: yarn --silent test:ci
+          command: yarn test:ci
       - store_artifacts:
           path: e2e/logs
+          destination: logs
+      - store_test_results:
+          path: ~/workbench/e2e/logs
